Compare with Old High German scif, German Schiff, Icelandic skip, Old English scip (â€œshipâ€), Old Norse skipja (â€œto fit out a shipâ€). See ship.

verbs.description: equip (third-person singular simple present equips, present participle equipping, simple past equipped, past participle equipped or (archaic) equipt)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To supply with something necessary in order to carry out a specific action or task; to provide with (e.g. weapons, provisions, munitions, rigging)
examples: it is no more than proper that you should equip us with a vessel in which to pursue the journey which you interrupted

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dress up; to array; to clothe.
examples: The country are led astray in following the town, and equipped in a ridiculous habit, when they fancy themselves in the height of the mode.

entries.meaning: (transitive, gaming) To equip oneself with (an item); to bring (equipment) into active use.
examples: Take it down from a distance with a magic spell, or equip your sword and attack it at close range.
